intro: Masdevallia mejiana, commonly known as the Mejian orchid, is a rare and exquisite orchid species native to the high-altitude cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, often colorful flowers with a unique, spurred shape. The plant typically grows as a small, terrestrial orchid with fleshy roots and narrow, strap-like leaves. Its blooms, which appear in late summer, are highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts due to their beauty and rarity. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
